Assessment.QuestionText: Which of these statements about menus are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: A context menu appears when the left mouse button is clicked.
The <font face="courier new">Shortcut</font> property of the <font face="courier new">MenuItem</font> class specifies the right-click as the short cut key to access the menu.
The <font face="courier new">ContextMenu</font> class exists in the <font face="courier new">System.Windows.Forms</font> namespace.
The <font face="courier new">IsParent</font> property of the <font face="courier new">MainMenu</font> class determines whether the menu consists of any child forms.
The <font face="courier new">MenuStrip</font> control helps you to add menus, modify, and reorder menus.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that's incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)-(False), (B)-(False), (C)-(True), (D)-(False), and (E)-(True).
